title: Around Valencia, almost a hundred dead in the 'floods of the century': 'The water came all at once, like a tsunami'
summary: The torrential rains that swept through southeastern Spain from Tuesday evening to Wednesday killed at least 95 people. Many are still missing.

title: US and South Korea call for North Korea to withdraw troops from Russia
summary: Russia and North Korea have deepened their political and military alliance as the Ukraine war has dragged on. Russia's President Vladimir Putin has not denied the deployment of North Korean troops to his country but has also refused to confirm it, while Russia's ambassador to the UN on Wednesday called them "mere assertions."

title: Beyoncé and Harris, Heston and Reagan, Sinatra and JFK ... the stars who support US presidential candidates
summary: On October 25, singer Beyoncé came to support Kamala Harris at a rally in Houston. Before the Queen of Pop, a number of high-profile stars have tried to swing the race for the White House in their candidate's favor.

title: Facebook company Meta shows strong growth as AI spending surges
summary: The parent company of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp said net profit in the third quarter was $15.7 billion – up 35% on the same period last year.

title: Trump taunts Democrats with 'garbage' stunt as Harris says, 'I strongly disagree with any criticism of people based on who they vote for'
summary: The row started over the weekend when a speaker at a Trump rally called Puerto Rico 'a floating island of garbage,' in remarks that initially put the Republican campaign on the defensive until Biden provided Trump the opportunity to play victim after the President appeared to label Trump supporters as 'garbage.'

title: In Arizona, this Latino family is switching to Trump after four generations of voting Democrat
summary: The Gomezes have lived in Douglas, a town on the border with Mexico, for over a century. Their rejection of immigration led them to support the Republican candidate.

title: French court jails ex-doctor for role in Rwandan genocide
summary: Eugene Rwamucyo's trial was the eighth in France relating to the genocide in 1994 when an estimated 800,000 people – mostly ethnic Tutsis – were slaughtered by the Hutu majority. The former doctor, 65, was found guilty of complicity in genocide, complicity in crimes against humanity and conspiring to prepare those crimes.

title: On what day are we most likely to die? Our birthday
summary: Statistically, the day we blow out our candles is the day we are most likely to die, according to an INSEE study. This is particularly true of young adults, as well as centenarians.

title: Hezbollah's new leader: Naim Kassem, the longtime deputy of Hassan Nasrallah
summary: Amid the ongoing Israeli offensive on Lebanon, the Iran-aligned armed group has promoted its deputy secretary general to succeed Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli strike. 'If the Israelis decide that they want to stop the aggression, we say we accept, but under the conditions that we see as appropriate and suitable," Kassem said.

title: Russia's ghost fleets, a strategic asset for selling sanctioned oil
summary: Hundreds of undercover tankers ply the seas with flags of convenience and hidden owners, ensuring that Moscow maintains its oil revenues throughout its war with Ukraine.

title: Why the impact of sanctions on Russian oil is weakening by the day
summary: Russian crude oil prices show that the effectiveness of sanctions against Moscow has diminished since the start of the war in Ukraine. Yet tightening them would entail risks for the global economy.

title: The Calabrian mafia's hold on Milan's football stands
summary: A vast judicial investigation is revealing the links between the 'Ndrangheta and the powerful ultras groups backing the city's two clubs, Internazionale and AC Milan.

title: Shell companies, ghost ships and secret traders: How Russia circumvents Western oil sanctions
summary: Le Monde reveals a large-scale system for circumventing sanctions on Moscow, orchestrated by several companies linked to Coral Energy, a company that works with France's Société Générale and TotalEnergies.

title: UK's Labour government hikes taxes in first budget
summary: British Treasury chief Rachel Reeves told lawmakers Wednesday that taxes will rise by £40 billion in order to plug a hole in the public finances and provide new funding for public services.

title: At COP 16, controversial 'biodiversity credits' are under discussion
summary: An advisory committee, led by France, has presented a roadmap designed to prevent these financial instruments, strongly criticized by some experts and nature conservation groups, from falling into the same pitfalls as carbon credits.

title: Harris pits her restraint against 'petty tyrant' Trump in last major speech
summary: With just one week to go before the presidential election, the Democratic candidate chose Washington's Ellipse lawn for her final big rally, the same spot where Donald Trump harangued his supporters on January 6, 2021, before storming the Capitol.

title: Donald Trump is once again ready to do anything to challenge the outcome if defeated
summary: The US is holding its breath, as the Republican candidate's methods have been known since 2020: unfounded proclamation of victory, possible local blockades by his supporters of the certification of results, judicial warfare and even violence.

title: French economy sees small boost from the Olympics but outlook remains gloomy
summary: The Olympic and Paralympic Games contributed 0.4% to GDP growth in the third quarter of 2024, boosting consumption. However, economic activity outside the Olympics appears sluggish and concerning for 2025.

title: United Kingdom: Unprecedented tax hikes and investments in the Starmer government's first budget
summary: The budget includes extraordinary tax increases of £40 billion a year, but also a £100 billion investment package over five years, in order to 'rebuild' the country and its public services, according to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.

title: Colombia establishes jaguar protection corridors
summary: Colombia is home to some 16,000 jaguars, but their habitat is becoming increasingly fragmented. A new initiative seeks to facilitate movement between these areas, particularly in the rural department of Guaviare, on the northern edge of the Amazon.

title: Decathlon, the French company that has conquered India
summary: The French sports brand employs 5,700 people in India and is appreciated for its low prices. In 2023, its local sales jumped by 37%, and over the next five years, it plans to invest €100 million on expansion, both online and in medium-sized towns.

title: Dodgers win World Series in Game 5, overcome 5-run deficit to beat Yankees 7-6
summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers have clinched the 2024 World Series championship, beating the New York Yankees at their home stadium in New York City late Wednesday night.

title: ECB President Christine Lagarde: 'Europe is falling behind, and France too'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the head of the European Central Bank criticizes Europe's tendency to regulate and calls for the development of a capital markets union.

title: In 'Anora,' from Las Vegas to Brooklyn, Sean Baker shatters the Hollywood mirage
summary: Palme d'Or winner at Cannes, 'Anora' by the American filmmaker follows the trials and tribulations of a young prostitute, a modern-day Cinderella pursued by the henchmen of her father-in-law, a Russian oligarch.

title: At Howard University, students hope alumna Kamala Harris will 'break the glass ceiling'
summary: Founded in 1867, Howard University in Washington DC, a historically Black university, could see one of its former students elected to the White House.

title: US presidential election 2024: How the Electoral College works
summary: In the United States, an electoral college of 538 members is designated by the states, based on their population. These electors vote for the president in the months following election day.

title: Floods in Spain: 'The Mediterranean's warming is dynamite'
summary: Antonio Aretxabala, a geologist and natural disasters expert, analyzes the reasons behind the high death toll and devastation following the floods that killed almost a hundred people in the Valencia region.

title: 'Four years later, the honeymoon between Biden and the Europeans has hit a few bumps in the road'
summary: While many European leaders were delighted with Donald Trump's defeat in 2020, they also had to come to terms with a certain continuity between the two presidents on foreign policy and the defense of American interests, writes Le Monde's Philippe Ricard.

title: Middle East war: Qlayaa, a Christian village in Lebanon, spared by Israel
summary: Many of the inhabitants of this village collaborated with Israel in the past. However, life in the middle of this devastated region is precarious and dominated by fear.

title: Super Typhoon Kong-rey strikes Taiwan
summary: One of the biggest storms to hit the island nation in decades, Kong-rey made landfall on Thursday, with 184-kilometer/hour wind speeds, floods and mudslides leading to at least one death and 73 injuries, according to the national fire agency.

title: Flooding in Spain: Valencia region authorities criticized for failure to warn of imminent disaster
summary: Although Spain's meteorological agency had warned of the arrival of a potentially dangerous cold drop, many Valencians were surprised not to receive a safety alert until 8 pm on Tuesday.

title: Residents flee as Israel strikes Lebanon's Baalbek and orders evacuations
summary: Israel carried out around 20 bombardments in and around the eastern Lebanese city on Wednesday, which the Israeli army claims is the site of Hezbollah infrastructure.

title: 'The identity and contours of the American working class are hard to pin down'
summary: The use of the expression 'working class' increased as factories disappeared from the economic landscape and union organizations lost their influence, points out US specialist Jean-Christian Vinel, in an article for Le Monde.

title: Le Pen's accountants take the stand in far right's fake jobs trial: 'A forgery could become the truth'
summary: The court interrogated the far-right Rassemblement National party's former accountants on Wednesday to find if the party's misappropriation of funds was a rigorously organized system.

title: In Shanghai, Halloween scares the authorities
summary: Despite a massive police presence, young people dressed up in costumes, some harmless, others very political. Everyone was told to get changed.

title: EU probes shopping app Temu over illegal products
summary: The European Union will look at the dangers of the platform's 'potentially addictive design,' which is used by around 92 million monthly users in the bloc.

title: French PhD student held in Tunisia, says supervisor
summary: Twenty-seven-year-old Vincent Dupont was conducting interviews in Tunisia for his PhD research before he was arrested on Saturday, October 19.

title: For Macron's visit to Morocco, some surprising guests were among plethoric delegation
summary: Three months after the publication of a report by France's audit court calling for further efforts to reduce the 'size of delegations' on state trips, the French president flew to Rabat with over 130 people, including close friends and family.

title: Paris set to limit traffic in the city's central core
summary: Starting next week, vehicles will be banned from transiting through the area, Paris City Hall announced on Thursday.

title: French PM Barnier 'doing well' after operation for 'cervical lesion'
summary: France's Prime Minister Michel Barnier was back at work after being 'operated on for a cervical lesion' at the weekend, according to his office.

title: Paris Masters: French tennis players in form at last edition before venue change
summary: Five French players, including Ugo Humbert and Arthur Fils, have made it through to the round of 16 of the Paris Masters at the Accor Arena on Thursday before the competition moves to the La Défense Arena next year.

title: Sciences Po Strasbourg cuts ties with Israeli university over Gaza war
summary: The French university broke off relations with the Reichman University near Tel Aviv, accusing it of 'warmongering' stances over the Gaza war.
